snippet: The former Maldives president, Mohamed Nasheed, faced possible arrest on Thursday after his unexpected resignation plunged his island nation into violent protests.
abstract: Mohamed Nasheed, former president of the Maldives, faces criminal charges and possible arrest after his unexpected resignation plunges the nation into violent protests and political turmoil; in televised interview, he claims that security officers have forced him to resign and that the new government is already backtracking on democracy.
lead_paragraph: The former Maldives president, Mohamed Nasheed, faced possible arrest on Thursday after his unexpected resignation plunged his island nation into violent protests.

headline.seo: Warrants Issued in Maldives for Ex-President Mohamed Nasheed
headline.main: Ex-Leader of Maldives Faces Criminal Charges 2 Days After Stepping Down
headline.print_headline: Ex-Leader of Maldives Faces Criminal Charges 2 Days After Stepping Down
